question: The living world is rich in ______.

An organism represents/occupies a place or ______ in the system of classification.

All the categories constitute a taxonomic ______.
The very range of organisms in terms of size, ______, habitat, physiological and morphological features make us seek the defining characteristics of living organisms.
Biologists have evolved certain ______ and principles for identification, nomenclature and classification of organisms.
